title: Mar-a-Lago -- and its owner -- have long caused concerns for US intelligence
New species of giant deep-sea isopod discovered in the Gulf of Mexico
description: A new deep-sea crustacean that bears a striking resemblance to the facehuggers from "Alien" has been identified off the Gulf of Mexico.

title: 18 children among dozens killed in Egypt church fire
description: At least 41 people were killed, and at least 14 injured after a fire broke out at Abu Sefein church in Cairo's Imbaba neighborhood on Sunday, according to a spokesperson for the Egyptian Coptic Church citing health officials.

title: Five Americans among injured in Jerusalem shooting attack
description: At least eight people, including four US tourists, were wounded in a shooting attack targeting a bus near the Western Wall in Jerusalem's Old City early Sunday morning.

title: Anne Heche to be taken off life support today, family says
description: Anne Heche, who remains hospitalized after crashing her vehicle into a Los Angeles residence last week, is "not expected to survive," according to a statement from her family and friends shared with CNN by a representative.

title: Prosecutor provides more details of Rushdie's wounds; suspect pleads not guilty
description: Renowned author Salman Rushdie remains hospitalized after being repeatedly stabbed during an on-stage attack in western New York that left him at risk of losing an eye, a prosecutor said during court proceedings Saturday.

title: Weapon in deadly 'Rust' film set shooting could not be fired without pulling the trigger, FBI forensic testing finds
description: FBI testing of the gun used in the fatal shooting on the movie set of "Rust" found that the weapon handled by actor Alec Baldwin could not be fired without pulling the trigger while the gun was cocked, according to a newly released forensics report.

title: The same Joe Biden suddenly looks different
description: Joe Biden is no more or less capable a president than he was two months ago. His staff is no more or less competent.

title: Norway euthanizes beloved 1,300-pound walrus named Freya
description: A massive, fish-loving walrus named Freya is stirring up trouble in Norway -- and the Norwegian government has warned it may have to euthanize her if Norwegians don't leave her alone.

title: A second US congressional delegation visits Taiwan
description: A US congressional delegation led by Massachusetts Democratic Sen. Ed Markey has arrived in Taipei on an unannounced two-day visit, Taiwan's Ministry of Foreign Affairs spokeswoman Joanne Ou said in a statement on Sunday night.

title: Deputy says he doesn't regret taking photos of remains in Kobe Bryant copter crash
description: Photos taken at the scene of the fatal helicopter crash that killed NBA legend Kobe Bryant, his daughter and seven others were shared by a Los Angeles County firefighter during the cocktail hour at an awards ceremony a month after the crash, according to witness testimony.

title: Liz Truss is Britain's likely next prime minister, but who really is she?
description: The person most likely to replace Boris Johnson as leader of Britain's governing Conservative Party and Prime Minister of the UK is a political chameleon who has gone from radical abolitionist to flag-bearer of the Euroskeptic, Conservative right.

title: David Popovici, 17, breaks 100m freestyle world record at European championships
description: Romanian teenager David Popovici set a world record in the 100-meter freestyle with a time of 46.86 seconds at the European championships in Rome on Saturday.

title: What a three-week drive around Ukraine's front lines taught me
Europe's drought could signal the death of river cruising
Man Utd manager on disastrous season start
description: Manager Erik ten Hag said Manchester United's game plan was put "in the bin" during a disastrous 4-0 defeat against Brentford.

title: They reached the Kobe Bryant crash site, then set off a chain reaction leading to a macabre court case
description: Amid heavy fog and dense brush, eight members of the Los Angeles County Sheriff's Department set off on foot up the remote terrain of the Santa Monica Mountains.

title: She fled Afghanistan with her law degree sewn into her dress. Many of her colleagues were left behind
description: When Fawzia Amini worked as a senior judge in Afghanistan's Supreme Court, she presided over cases of violent crimes against women, hearing harrowing and heart-breaking accounts of child marriage, sexual assault and femicide.

title: Just when you thought it was safe to get back in the pandemic-snarled water, Europe is having another cataclysmic summer
Apples, pumpkins and even tequila: Losing critical populations could mean losing some favorite food and drink
description: Bee populations are declining. More than half of the bat species in the United States are in severe decline or listed as endangered. And international scientists recently announced the monarch butterfly is perilously close to extinction.

title: A nation used to relentless rain is struggling with extreme heat
description: • The Rhine river is drying up, making it hard for cargo ships to travel

title: India's 'Warren Buffett,' Rakesh Jhunjhunwala, dies at 62
description: Indian billionaire Rakesh Jhunjhunwala, sometimes called "India's Warren Buffett," died Sunday at age 62, according to Prime Minister Narendra Modi.

title: On the shoulders of Jackie Robinson, today's Dodgers players reflect on his impact
description: "When Jackie Robinson stepped on the field as a member of the Brooklyn Dodgers, for us Black folk, it was our Neil Armstrong landing on the moon," said Bob Kendrick, president of the Negro Leagues Baseball Museum in Kansas City.

title: Armed Trump supporters show up outside FBI office in Arizona
description: Armed Trump supporters gathered outside the Phoenix FBI office after what they call the "unlawful" search of Mar-a-Lago.

title: Hear the loud boom that officials believe was a meteor hitting atmosphere
description: A high-altitude meteor that blew up when it hit the atmosphere "is likely the best theory" for a loud boom heard across portions of northern Utah and southern Idaho, said Utah Gov. Spencer Cox. CNN's Gene Norman reports.

title: Taiwan blames politics for cancellation of global Pride event
description: Taiwan on Friday blamed "political considerations" for the cancellation of WorldPride 2025 Taiwan after it said the organizers had insisted the word "Taiwan" be removed.

title: 'Lives torn asunder.' The children of Indian Partition, 75 years on
description: A small girl is woken in the night. The family is to travel immediately from their idyllic home near Lahore, in what is current-day Pakistan, to India.
